thread.title: Aloha woman, 71, with dementia is missing, officials say
thread.title_full: Aloha woman, 71, with dementia is missing, officials say | OregonLive.com

author: Luke Hammill | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Aloha woman, 71, with dementia is missing, officials say
text:
The Washington County Sheriff's Office is asking for help finding a missing Aloha woman.
Nancy Mabe WCSO Nancy Mabe, 71, suffers from dementia, officials said. She left her home at 11 a.m. Friday morning and headed for a Kaiser Permanente clinic in Beaverton, according to a news release.
Mabe does not drive often and was driving alone on Friday, sheriff's deputies said. She made a purchase at a pharmacy and left, according to the release.
Family members contacted law enforcement when they were unable to find Mabe, officials said. Her credit card transactions show gas purchases in Boardman around 5 p.m. and Hood River at 8:30 p.m., sheriff's deputies said.
Mabe is driving a green 2002 Subaru Forester with Oregon license plate YXT-766, authorities said. She is five feet, four inches tall, with brown eyes and short gray hair.
Anyone who finds Mabe should call 911, officials said.
-- Luke Hammill
lhammill@oregonian.com
